title: Ticket #2840: glexec causes jobs to 'exit' without running
description:
When condor is configured to use glexec, we have observed a situation where the job appears to exit with status 1, even though the job in fact was never started. The stderr of the job contains the following message: 

    fdpass_recv error on new_sock_fd

This was observed at DESY with Condor 7.6.4.

Here is the story:

  1. Condor starts condor_glexec_run with only one open file descriptor: fd 0, which is a socket for communication with the starter.

  2. condor_glexec_run calls glexec to run condor_glexec_job_wrapper.

  3. By the time condor_glexec_job_wrapper is run, file descriptors 1 and 3 but not 2 are also open. They point to some socket (not sure where that came from).

  4. condor_glexec_job_wrapper does not behave correctly if file descriptor 1 and/or 2 are not open. The fact that 2 is not open therefore triggers the bug. The bug was introduced in [11658] (7.2). Prior to 7.6.2 (#1642), the effect of this bug in condor_glexec_job_wrapper was different. It could have caused failure to detect exec() failure when starting the job. Starting in 7.6.2, the effect of the bug is worse: it causes condor_glexec_job_wrapper to fail to start the job and for Condor to think that the job did start. In 7.7, this bug does not get triggered, because Condor opens a pipe for stdout/stderr from glexec (#2259) and hence is not dependent on how glexec behaves when stdout/stderr are not open when it is called.

At DESY, glite-GLEXEC_wn/node-version contains the version string 3.2.6-3, which I believe means glexec is version 0.8.1-1.
remarks:
2012-Feb-22 17:18:40 by danb:
The following shell script can be used to mimic the way condor calls glexec. 

#!/bin/sh
exec 3>&1 1>&- 2>&- /opt/glite/sbin/glexec /bin/sh -c '/usr/sbin/lsof -p $$ 1>&3'

At DESY, this shows the problematic 'hole' in the open file descriptors: 

bash    12522 cmsplt012    0u   CHR              136,0                2 /dev/pts/0
bash    12522 cmsplt012    1u  unix 0xffff810424a14f00         60858654 socket
bash    12522 cmsplt012    3u   CHR              136,0                2 /dev/pts/0
bash    12522 cmsplt012    4u  unix 0xffff810424a14f00         60858654 socket
bash    12522 cmsplt012    5r   REG                8,3     646   590363 /opt/glite/etc/lcmaps/lcmaps-glexec.db

The lcmaps-related file that is open makes me wonder if this problem has something to do with the lcmaps configuration.

When I run this test at T2_US_Wisconsin, I get the following (no holes) 

bash    16878 osg_cmsuser01    0u   CHR  136,0                2 /dev/pts/0
bash    16878 osg_cmsuser01    1r   CHR    1,3             2215 /dev/null
bash    16878 osg_cmsuser01    2r   CHR    1,3             2215 /dev/null
bash    16878 osg_cmsuser01    3u   CHR  136,0                2 /dev/pts/0

The Wisconsin glexec is from rpm glexec-0.8.10-8.osg.

2012-Feb-23 17:17:33 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Wow, what a find, nice detective work. Patch looks good. Just need a quick version history blurb, so moving ticket to doc pending state.

2012-Feb-28 11:45:33 by danb:

It turns out that DESY had glexec configured in log-only mode. This means glexec was not setuid-root. Linux forces opening of /dev/null for the stdio descriptors for setuid-root programs running as non-root. This explains why we do not normally see this problem: it only affect log-only mode. Though Condor no longer cares, Mischa has now fixed gLExec 0.9.3 to open /dev/null for missing stdio descriptors, even when running in log-only mode.
